title: For U.S. Inflation, China’s Slowdown Is a Double-Edged Sword
sub_head: China’s manufacturing juggernaut is being punished by lockdowns in Shanghai and elsewhere. The impact on prices will spread.
body:
Global investors’ eyes are focused on the Fed—and U.S. inflation. To understand how the latter will evolve, they should pay more attention to the world’s second-largest economy.
China’s impact on the U.S. inflation picture will be more profound than many appreciate, but also works through two different channels. Which one ends up predominating will be a significant factor for inflation later this year, and how aggressively the Fed ultimately has to move to contain it.
